subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to skip a test case and go to next one at runtime....Plz suggest if ther's any other way !!!
msgSnippet: ... It looks like a good solution to me.  Can you explain what you want to do that this solution prevents?  Thanks, David
messageBody:
On Thu, Oct 14, 2010 at 5:11 AM, sumeshbadge <sumeshbadge@...> wrote:
> Actually this is not really what I'm looking for. let me explain u one scenario:
>
> testcase1{
> callThisMethod(some arg);
> assert1();
> assert2();
> assert3();
> // the no. of asserts is not fixed. there can be any no. of asserts.
> }
>
> testcase2{
> callThisMethod(some arg);
> assert1();
> assert2();
> assert3();
> // the no. of asserts is not fixed. there can be any no. of asserts.
> }
>
> testcase3{
> assert1();
> assert2();
> // the no. of asserts is not fixed. there can be any no. of asserts.
> }
>
> public void callThisMethod(some arg){
> // code to check some condition here.
> }
>
> So, I'm not sure in how many test cases "callThisMethod(some arg)" is being used, but what I want is whenever "callThisMethod(some arg)" is called, then based on the condition in this method the rest of the asserts for this test should be executed or skipped.
> For example in  testcase1() when callThisMethod(some arg) is called and condition is not met I don't want to execute the remainign asserts in that test and instead go to next test.
> However if the condition is met I want to execute the asserts.
>
> I know I can make callThisMethod return a boolean value and do this:
>
> testcase1{
> if (callThisMethod(some arg)) {
> assert1();
> assert2();
> assert3();
> // the no. of asserts is not fixed. there can be any no. of asserts.
> }
> }
>
> but this is really not a good solution. Any solution/suggestion/ideas are welcomed :) !!

It looks like a good solution to me. Can you explain what you want to
do that this solution prevents? Thanks,

David

>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Mike Forsberg <bigmike.f@...> wrote:
>>
>> Well if you're not trying to be too fancy, have you thought of...
>>
>> testcase1() {
>>    if (someCondition) return;
>>    //... rest of test case if !someCondition
>> }
>>
>>
>> On Tue, Oct 12, 2010 at 11:53 PM, sumeshbadge <sumeshbadge@...> wrote:
>>
>> >
>> >
>> > Hi David,
>> >
>> > I'm currently using Junit 3.8
>> >
>> >
>> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com>, David Saff <david@>
>> > wrote:
>> > >
>> > > sumeshbadge,
>> > >
>> > > Are you using JUnit 3 style, or JUnit 4 style? The answer depends on
>> > > that. Thanks,
>> > >
>> > > David Saff
>> > >
>> > > On Tue, Oct 12, 2010 at 8:32 AM, sumeshbadge <sumeshbadge@> wrote:
>> > > > Hi,
>> > > >
>> > > > I want to skip a test case and go to the next one based on some
>> > conditions. For ex:
>> > > >
>> > > > testcase1{
>> > > > // some condition
>> > > > }
>> > > >
>> > > > testcase2{
>> > > > }
>> > > >
>> > > > What I exactly want is; while executing testcase1() if "some condition"
>> > fails (or is not meet) then go to next test case i.e testcase2(). Is there
>> > any way to achieve this???
>> > > > Please reply if you have any thoughts!!!
>> > > >
>> > > >
